sen.e: High treason cases

sen.cmt: 「大逆事件」は明治に起きた一連の事件を指します。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A4%A7%E9%80%86%E4%BA%8B%E4%BB%B6）"high treason cases"は、国家や君主への反逆、という一般的な名詞なので、ここは固有名詞としてローマ字表記の方が良いと思います。
sen.e: Taigyaku Jiken

sen.j: 1882年に施行された旧刑法116条、および大日本帝国憲法制定後の1908年に施行された刑法73条（1947年に削除）が規定していた、天皇、皇后、皇太子等を狙って危害を加えたり、加えようとする罪、いわゆる大逆罪が適用され、訴追された事件の総称。
sen.e: High treason cases are a general term to refer to crimes in which perpetrators inflicted or tried to inflict harm on Emperor, Empress and Crown Prince and were prosecuted for committing lese majesty based on the article 116 of the former Panel Code enacted in 1882 and the article 73 of the Panel Code enforced in 1908 (the article was eliminated in 1947).

Taigyaku Jiken is a collective term referring to the incidents in which perpetrators were prosecuted for high treason, which was a crime to inflict or try to inflict harm on Emperor, Empress or Crown Prince, as defined in the article 116 of the former Penal Code enforced in 1882 and the article 73 of the Penal Code enforced in 1908 after the enactment of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan (the article was eliminated in 1947).
sen.cmt: 「大逆事件」は特定の事件を指す固有名詞。「総称」→一般的な総称ではなく、特定の事件をまとめて呼ぶ名称。"Panel Code"は"Penal Code"のスペルミス。「施行された」は"enforced"で統一しました。「大日本帝国憲法制定後の」→訳抜けです。
sen.e: Taigyaku Jiken is a collective term referring to the incidents in which perpetrators were prosecuted for high treason, which was a crime to inflict or try to inflict harm on Emperor, Empress or Crown Prince, as defined in the article 116 of the former Penal Code enforced in 1882 and the article 73 of the Penal Code enforced in 1908 after the enactment of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan (the article was eliminated in 1947).

sen.j: 日本以外では皇帝や王に叛逆し、また謀叛をくわだてた犯罪を、大逆罪と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: Outside of Japan, crimes of treason and rebellion against Emperor or King are sometimes called lese majesty.
Outside of Japan, crimes of treason and rebellion against Emperor or King are sometimes called high treason.
sen.cmt: "lese majesty"も、「大逆罪」を意味するようですが、上記と統一するために"high treason"と修正しました。
sen.e: Outside of Japan, crimes of treason and rebellion against Emperor or King are sometimes called high treason.

sen.j: 特に一般には1910,1911年（明治42,43年）に社会主義者幸徳秋水らが天皇暗殺計画を企てたとして検挙された事件を指す（幸徳事件ともいわれる）。
sen.e: In Japan, a high treason case especially refers to the so-called Kotoku Incident in which Shusui KOTOKU, a socialist, was prosecuted for trying to kill then-Emperor in 1910 and 1911.
Generally, Taigyaku Jiken especially refers to the so-called Kotoku Incident in which Shusui KOTOKU, a socialist, was prosecuted for trying to kill then-Emperor in 1910 and 1911.

sen.j: 政治制度として天皇制を重視した大日本帝国憲法下の日本政府は大逆罪を重罪とし、死刑・極刑をもって臨んだ。
sen.e: The Japanese government treated lese majesty as a felony and punished offenders capitally in accordance with the Constitution of the Empire of Japan which put a great importance on the Emperor system adopted under the Constitution in governing the nation.

The Japanese government, putting a great importance on the Emperor system to govern the nation under the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, treated high treason as a felony and punished offenders capitally.
sen.cmt: "lese majesty"も、「大逆罪」を意味するようですが、上記と統一するために"high treason"と修正しました。文法上の修正をしました。

sen.j: 裁判は非公開で行なわれ、大審院（現・最高裁判所）が審理する一審制（「第一審ニシテ終審」）となっていた。
sen.e: Trials for lese-majesty offenders were undertaken behind closed doors by Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) and appeals by the offenders were not accepted (the first and last instance).

sen.j: 1910年(明治43年)5月25日、信州の社会主義者宮下太吉ら4名による明治天皇暗殺計画が発覚し逮捕された「信州明科爆裂弾事件」が起こる。
sen.e: On May 25, 1910, 'Shinshu Akashina Bomb Incident' occurred, in which a socialist in the Shinshu region, Takichi MIYASHITA, and other three socialists were arrested for plotting to kill the Meiji Emperor.

sen.j: 以降、この事件を口実に全ての社会主義者、アナキスト（無政府主義者）に対して取り調べや家宅捜索が行なわれ、根絶やしにする弾圧を、政府が主導、フレームアップ（政治的でっちあげ）したとされる事件。
sen.e: The Incident triggered the Japanese government to step up crackdowns on all the socialists and anarchists through investigations and house search and the government even faked treason cases in an effort to eradicate them.

sen.j: 信州明科爆裂弾事件後、数百人の社会主義者・無政府主義者の逮捕・検挙が始まり、検察は26人を明治天皇暗殺計画容疑として起訴した。
sen.e: Since the Shinshu Akashina Bomb Incident, several million socialists and anarchists were arrested and prosecutors indicted 26 people for the suspicion of plotting to kill Emperor Meiji.

sen.e: After 1960s, 'the association to find a truth of Taigyaku Jiken' led the movement to demand retrial of the case.
sen.cmt: 「大逆事件」は固有名詞。"lead"→"led"に修正。"led the movement and"だと、「その運動を推進し、そして」になり、"the movement"が何を指すのか曖昧です。
sen.e: After 1960s, 'the association to find a truth of Taigyaku Jiken' led the movement to demand retrial of the case.

sen.j: 1923年12月27日、難波大助（なんば だいすけ）が虎ノ門で第48帝国議会の開院式に向かう摂政・皇太子裕仁親王（後の昭和天皇）の車に向けてステッキ状の拳銃を発砲・狙撃し、現行犯で逮捕された暗殺未遂事件。
sen.e: The Toranomon Incident was an assassination attempt occurred on December 27, 1923 by Daisuke NANBA who fired a stick-shaped gun at Prince Hirohito, then-regent and crown prince, when Prince was heading for the opening ceremony of the 48th Imperial Diet by car and NANBA was arrested red-handed.

The Toranomon Incident was an assassination attempt occurred on December 27, 1923 at Toranomon, by Daisuke NANBA who fired a stick-shaped gun at Imperial Prince Hirohito (later the Emperor Showa), then-regent and crown prince, when Prince was heading by car for the opening ceremony of the 48th Imperial Diet, and Nanba was arrested red-handed.
sen.cmt: 「親王」→用語統一リストに従って修正。「虎ノ門で」、（後の昭和天皇）→訳抜けです。
sen.e: The Toranomon Incident was an assassination attempt occurred on December 27, 1923 at Toranomon, by Daisuke NANBA who fired a stick-shaped gun at Imperial Prince Hirohito (later the Emperor Showa), then-regent and crown prince, when Prince was heading by car for the opening ceremony of the 48th Imperial Diet, and Nanba was arrested red-handed.

sen.j: 皇太子に怪我は無かったが、隣に座っていた侍従が顔に負傷。
sen.e: Prince was not wounded but a chamberlain sitting next to him suffered an injury on his face.
Prince was not wounded but a chamberlain sitting next to him suffered an injury on his face.

sen.j: 1924年11月13日に大審院で死刑判決。
sen.e: NANBA was sentenced to death in Daishin-in on November 13, 1924.
Nanba was sentenced to death in Daishin-in on November 13, 1924.
Nanba was sentenced to death in Daishin-in on November 13, 1924.

sen.j: 11月15日に死刑執行。
sen.e: The sentence was carried out on November 15, the same year.
The sentence was carried out on November 15, the same year.
The sentence was carried out on November 15, the same year.

sen.j: この事件により、山本権兵衛内閣は総辞職、警視総監・湯浅倉平、警視庁警務部長・正力松太郎らが懲戒免職、難波の出身地である山口県の知事が2ヶ月間の減給となった。
sen.e: For the Incident, the Gombei YAMAMOTO cabinet resigned en masse, Kurahei YUASA, then-Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner, and Matsutaro SHORIKI, then-director of police administration of Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, were given a dishonorable discharge, and the governor of Yamaguchi Prefecture, where NANBA was born, was reprimanded with a pay cut for two month.

Due to the Incident, the Gonbei YAMAMOTO cabinet resigned en masse, Tokyo Metropolitan Police Commissioner Kurahei YUASA and Director of Police Administration of Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department Matsutaro SHORIKI were given a dishonorable discharge, and the governor of Yamaguchi Prefecture, where Nanba was born, was reprimanded with a pay cut for two months.
sen.cmt: "For"→"Due to"に修正。"Gombei"→"Gonbei"に修正しました。役職名はタイトルとして名前の前に修正しました。"NANBA"→"Nanba"に修正。"two month"→"two months"に修正しました。
sen.e: Due to the Incident, the Gonbei YAMAMOTO cabinet resigned en masse, Tokyo Metropolitan Police Commissioner Kurahei YUASA and Director of Police Administration of Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department Matsutaro SHORIKI were given a dishonorable discharge, and the governor of Yamaguchi Prefecture, where Nanba was born, was reprimanded with a pay cut for two months.

sen.j: 衆議院議員で庚申倶楽部だった大助の父難波作之進は即日議員辞職し、山口県熊毛郡 (山口県)周防村（現・山口県光市）の自宅で閉門蟄居後、食事を取らず餓死した。
sen.e: Daisuke's father, Sakunoshin NANBA, who was a member of the House of Representatives and also a member of the Koshin club (parliamentary group), resigned immediately, and was starved to death by refusing food after confined himself to his own house of Suo Village, Kumage County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present-day, Hikari City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).

Daisuke's father, Sakunoshin NANBA, who was a member of the House of Representatives and also a member of the Koshin club (parliamentary group), resigned immediately, and starved to death by refusing food after confining himself to his own house in Suo Village, Kumage County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present-day, Hikari City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「親王」→用語統一リストに従って修正しました。他、文法上の修正をしました。
sen.e: Daisuke's father, Sakunoshin NANBA, who was a member of the House of Representatives and also a member of the Koshin club (parliamentary group), resigned immediately, and starved to death by refusing food after confining himself to his own house in Suo Village, Kumage County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present-day, Hikari City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 1923年9月1日に起きた関東大震災の2日後、戒厳令下に朝鮮民族が民衆によって私刑を受けた。
sen.e: Two days after the Great Kanto Earthquake of September 1, 1923, a series of lynching of Korean people by Japanese nationals occurred under martial law.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: その震災後の混乱期に、「保護検束」の名目で検挙されたアナキスト・朴烈と愛人の金子文子が、翌1924年2月15日に爆発物取締罰則違反で起訴され、1925年5月2日に朴烈が、5月4日に文子が、それぞれ大逆罪にあたるとされた事件。
sen.e: During such chaotic period, an anarchist, Bokuretsu and his mistress, Fumiko KANEKO, were arrested under the pretext of 'protective custody' and indicted for an offense against the Explosives Control Act on February 15, 1924, and later their charge was switched to high crime against the Imperial Family and the two were prosecuted again on May 2, 1925 and May 4 respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During such chaotic period after the earthquake, anarchist Bokuretsu and his mistress Fumiko KANEKO were arrested under the pretext of 'protective custody' and indicted for an offense against the Explosives Control Act on February 15, 1924, and later their charge was switched to high treason and the two were prosecuted again on May 2, 1925 and May 4 respectively.
sen.cmt: 「その震災後の混乱期」→"after the earthquake"を挿入。「大逆罪」→"high treason"で統一しました。
sen.e: During such chaotic period after the earthquake, anarchist Bokuretsu and his mistress Fumiko KANEKO were arrested under the pretext of 'protective custody' and indicted for an offense against the Explosives Control Act on February 15, 1924, and later their charge was switched to high treason and the two were prosecuted again on May 2, 1925 and May 4 respectively.

sen.j: 1926年3月25日に死刑判決。
sen.e: Bokuretsu and Fumiko were sentenced to death on March 25, 1926.
Bokuretsu and Fumiko were sentenced to death on March 25, 1926.
Bokuretsu and Fumiko were sentenced to death on March 25, 1926.

sen.j: 4月5日に恩赦で懲役に減刑されるが、文子は特赦状を刑務所長の面前で破り捨てた。
sen.e: Although their death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment under an amnesty on April 5, Fumiko tore up the pardon order in front of a warden.
Although their death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment under an amnesty on April 5, Fumiko tore up the pardon order in front of a warden.

sen.j: 同年7月22日に栃木女囚刑務所で、文子は刑務官の目を盗んで縊死。
sen.e: Fumiko hanged herself on July 22, the same year, behind the eyes of prison guards in the Tochigi female prison.
Fumiko hanged herself on July 22, the same year, behind the eyes of prison guards in the Tochigi female prison.
Fumiko hanged herself on July 22, the same year, behind the eyes of prison guards in the Tochigi female prison.

sen.j: 同年7月には内閣転覆を狙った北一輝により取調中に朴の膝に金子が座り抱擁している写真が政界にばらまかれ獄内での待遇が数ヶ月政治問題化した。
sen.e: In July, the same year, Ikki KITA who plotted to overturn the Cabinet distributed among political figures a photo of Bokuretsu holding KANEKO on his knees in the interrogation, and the treatment of the two in the prison became a political issue for several months.

In July, the same year, Ikki KITA who was plotting to overturn the Cabinet distributed among political figures a photo of Bokuretsu holding Kaneko on his knees in the interrogation, and the treatment of the two in the prison became a political issue for several months.
sen.cmt: "plotted to"→"was plotting to"に修正。"KANEKO"→"Kaneko"に修正しました。
sen.e: In July, the same year, Ikki KITA who was plotting to overturn the Cabinet distributed among political figures a photo of Bokuretsu holding Kaneko on his knees in the interrogation, and the treatment of the two in the prison became a political issue for several months.

sen.j: 朴烈は敗戦後の1945年10月27日に出獄。
sen.e: Bokuretsu was discharged from prison on October 27, 1945 after Japan's defeat in World War II.
Bokuretsu was discharged from prison on October 27, 1945 after Japan's defeat in World War II.

sen.j: いまや徹底した反共主義の持ち主であった朴は在日本朝鮮人連盟（朝連、在日本朝鮮人総聯合会の前身）への参加を避け、1946年10月に在日本大韓民国民団の前身となる在日本朝鮮居留民団を結成し、初代団長を1949年2月まで勤めた。
sen.e: Bokuretsu who came out of prison as a committed anticommunist did not join the Federation of the Korean in Japan (present-day, General Association of Korean Residents) but formed 在日本朝鮮居留民団 (present-day, Korean Residents Union in Japan) in October 1946 and presided as the first organization head until February 1949.
sen.cmt: 在日本朝鮮居留民団：英語名不明です。
sen.e: Bokuretsu who came out of prison as a committed anticommunist did not join Zai Nihon Chosenjin Renmei (present-day, Chongryon or General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) but formed Zai Nihon Chosen Kyoryumindan (present-day, Mindan or Korean Residents Union in Japan) in October 1946 and presided as the first organization head until February 1949.
sen.cmt: 「在日本朝鮮人連盟」→訳文では、"Residents"が抜けているように見えますが、私が調べた限りでは英語名称不明です。同じく不明の「在日本朝鮮居留民団」とともにローマ字表記が良いと思います。「朝連」→Chongryonというようです。また、「在日本朝鮮人総聯合会」の訳に"in Japan"を付け加えました。（http://www.asahi.com/english/TKY201008040278.html）「在日本大韓民国民団」→"Mindan"という略称が公式で使われているようです。（http://www.mindan.org/eng/）

sen.j: 帰国後李承晩政権の国務委員を勤めるが、朝鮮戦争の際、朝鮮民主主義人民共和国へ連行。
sen.e: After going back to Korea, he served as the commissioner of internal affairs of the Syngman Rhee administration, but was later taken to Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea) during the Korean War.

sen.j: 後に南北平和統一委員会副委員長として活動。
sen.e: Bokuretsu was actively involved in the Korean peace effort as the vice-chairman of the peaceful unification committee of the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 朝鮮独立運動の活動家・李奉昌（イ・ボンチャン）が1932年1月8日、桜田門外において陸軍始観兵式を終えて帰途についていた昭和天皇の馬車に向かって手榴弾を投げつけ、近衛兵一人を負傷させた事件。
sen.e: Lee Bong-chang, an activist of pro-Korean independence, hurled a grenade at the horse-drawn carriage of Emperor Showa when Emperor was on his way home after the military review of the Japanese Army taken place outside the Sakuradamon Gate, and in the Incident one imperial guard was injured.
sen.cmt: 陸軍始観兵式：英語名不明です。
sen.e: Lee Bong-chang, an activist for Korean independence, hurled a grenade at the horse-drawn carriage of the Emperor Showa when the Emperor was on his way home after the military review of the Japanese Army taken place outside the Sakuradamon Gate, and in the Incident one imperial guard was injured.
sen.cmt: "activist of pro-Korean independence"→"activist for Korean independence"に修正。"Emperor"に"the"を付けました。

sen.j: 李奉昌事件、あるいは桜田門不敬事件とも呼ばれ、また日本政府は李奉昌不敬事件と呼んだ。
sen.e: This incident was commonly called Lee Bong-chang Incident or Sakuradamon lese majesty Incidence, while the Japanese government especially called it Lee Bong-chang lese majesty Incident.

sen.j: 時の首相犬養毅は辞表を提出するも慰留された。
sen.e: Then-prime minister, Tsuyoshi INUKAI, submitted his letter of resignation but was persuaded to stay in office.

sen.e: Lee was sentenced to death in Daishin-in on September 30 and executed in the Ichigaya prison on October 10, 1932.

sen.j: 1946年に在日韓国・朝鮮人が遺骨を発掘、故国である朝鮮において国民葬が行われた。
sen.e: In 1946, North and South Korean residents in Japan uncovered his remains and a national funeral was carried out in his native country, South Korea.
